summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Life of Birds
Review Date: 2013/02/14
Store: Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
Product Description: ["The definitive series on the most colorful, popular and perfectly adapted creatures on earth, The Life of Birds traverses the globe, covering 42 countries and examining over 300 different species. Calling upon the immense skills of many of the world's top wildlife cameramen and women, and pushing filming technology to the limits, new behavior is brought to the screen in staggering detail. Infra-red cameras find oilbirds deep in pitch black caves. Ultra slow motion film unravels the complexities of bird flight and ultraviolet cameras reveal the world from a bird's point of view."]
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Classics, Documentary', 'Format': "Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Full Screen, NTSC, Collector's Edition", 'Contributor': 'David Attenborough', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.75 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Media Format': "Multiple Formats, Box set, Closed-captioned, Full Screen, NTSC, Collector's Edition", 'Run time': '9 hours', 'Release date': 'September 27, 2005', 'Studio': 'BBC Video', 'Number of discs': '3'}
Review Text: This was purchased as a gift and was greatly appreciated.  It is always exciting to give something that can be enjoyed by the whole family over and over.
Review Title: Makes a great gift!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: This is one of those classic love stories that you just can't stop watching, over, and over.  You get a true feel for this historical period, without the Hollywood glitter and glamor we so often see. One of my favorite movies.
Review Title: A true classic!
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Cayman Went
Review Date: 2013/10/02
Store: Michael Lombardi  (Actor),     Jeff Demunn  (Actor),     Bobby Sheehan  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
Product Description: ['TV personality Josh Anders (Michael Lombardi, FX’s Rescue Me) is a legend in his own mind … and even he has doubts. Ratings are down and the hottie star of Diver Down (a male Baywatch) can’t get arrested in Hollywood these days. When the smug pretty boy receives an ultimatum from an ultra-wealthy, powerful andunethical resort developer – who also happens to own the network that broadcasts his show – Josh finds himself the key player in a land grab scheme targeting the picturesque, unspoiled and tiny Caribbean island of Cayman Brac.The laid-back locals, most of them big fans, are putty in his hands, except for theeccentric Mr. Bowman (Jeffrey Demunn, Burn After Reading, Hollywoodland, CBS’s Law & Order, The Shawshank Redemption), a cranky retiree who’s never even heard of the show.Secretly petrified of the ocean, Josh just wants to close the deal and go home. That is until Mr. Bowman, a parentless kid named Rodney and Darby Thomas (Susan Misner,Chicago, Eavesdrop), the beautiful but opinionated owner of the local Sand Bar, change his mind about what really matters most.A romantic drama that proves It’s all good … if you just know what to look for.']
Average Rating: 4.0
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Susan Misner, Eyalan Owona, Susan Misner, Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Jim Ritterhoff, Eyalan Owona, Bobby SheehanMichael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Susan Misner, Eyalan Owona, Susan Misner, Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Jim Ritterhoff, Eyalan Owona, Bobby Sheehan  See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 29 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.5 Ounces', 'Director': 'Bobby Sheehan', 'Media Format': 'NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 29 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 19, 2014', 'Actors': 'Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Susan Misner, Eyalan Owona, Michael Lombardi, Jeff Demunn, Susan Misner, Eyalan Owona', 'Studio': 'Osiris Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Jim Ritterhoff, Bobby Sheehan', 'Number of discs': '1'}

Review Date: 2016/02/01
Store: Paul Rudd  (Actor, Writer),     Evangeline Lilly  (Actor),     Peyton Reed  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ["The next evolution of the Marvel Cinematic Universe harnesses the tiniest but mightiest force know to man and introduces the newest member of the Avengers: MARVEL'S ANT-MAN. Armed with the amazing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, master thief Scott Lang joins forces with his new mentor Dr. Hank Pym to protect the secret behind his spectacular Ant-Man suit from ruthless villains! With humanity's fate in the balance, Pym and Lang must plan and pull off a daring heist against insurmountable odds. Filled with humor, awesome special effects and exclusive bonus features, this action-packed adventure takes you to new levels of pulse-pounding excitement!"]

Review Text: Loved this movie when I saw It in the theater, so had to buy it to add to my collection.  I enjoy that this movie takes time to develop the characters, has a great sense of humor, and the action scenes with the Ants are very cool.  Great movie for the whole family to watch.

Review Text: Everyone should watch this documentary about the effects that sugar has on your body.  Mr. Gameau was able to put together the story of sugar in a way that is interesting and horrifying at the same time.  As someone who was recently diagnosed as diabetic, I wish I had seen this a long time ago. Perhaps I would have made different choices and avoided this disease altogether.
Review Title: Great documentary!

Review Title: I've really enjoyed this show and will be sorry when it is ...

prompt:
Based on the provided purchase history, generate three separate summaries focusing on different aspects of the user's experiences. Each summary should be under 256 words. Focus only on keywords and clear trends supported by multiple interactions. Do not repeat specific product names or details. avoid repeating product names, specifications, or technical details:

        1. POSITIVE: Describe only the positive experiences and what was liked.

        2. NEGATIVE: Describe only the negative experiences and what was disliked.

        3. OVERALL: Provide a overall summary including both positive and negative aspects.

        Here's the purchase data:

        === Purchase Information ===

Review Date: 2013/02/14

Calling upon the immense skills of many of the world's top wildlife cameramen and women, and pushing filming technology to the limits, new behavior is brought to the screen in staggering detail. Infra-red cameras find oilbirds deep in pitch black caves. Ultra slow motion film unravels the complexities of bird flight and ultraviolet cameras reveal the world from a bird's point of view."]

Product Title: Cayman Went
Review Date: 2013/10/02
Store: Michael Lombardi  (Actor),     Jeff Demunn  (Actor),     Bobby Sheehan  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
Product Description: ['TV personality Josh Anders (Michael Lombardi, FX’s Rescue Me) is a legend in his own mind … and even he has doubts. Ratings are down and the hottie star of Diver Down (a male Baywatch) can’t get arrested in Hollywood these days. When the smug pretty boy receives an ultimatum from an ultra-wealthy, powerful andunethical resort developer – who also happens to own the network that broadcasts his show – Josh finds himself the key player in a land grab scheme targeting the picturesque, unspoiled and tiny Caribbean island of Cayman Brac.The laid-back locals, most of them big fans, are putty in his hands, except for theeccentric Mr. Bowman (Jeffrey Demunn, Burn After Reading, Hollywoodland, CBS’s Law & Order, The Shawshank Redemption), a cranky retiree who’s never even heard of the show.Secretly petrified of the ocean, Josh just wants to close the deal and go home. That is until Mr. Bowman, a parentless kid named Rodney and Darby Thomas (Susan Misner,Chicago, Eavesdrop), the beautiful but opinionated owner of the local Sand Bar, change his mind about what really matters most.A romantic drama that proves It’s all good … if you just know what to look for.']

Review Text: Everyone should watch this documentary about the effects that sugar has on your body.  Mr. Gameau was able to put together the story of sugar in a way that is interesting and horrifying at the same time.  As someone who was recently diagnosed as diabetic, I wish I had seen this a long time ago. Perhaps I would have made different choices and avoided this disease altogether.
Review Title: Great documentary!

POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user has enjoyed several positive experiences, consistently reflecting appreciation for the various movie genres. High ratings highlight family-friendly films that foster collective enjoyment, with particular praise for the engaging narratives and character development. The user finds satisfaction in documentaries and classic love stories, noting their educational or emotional resonance. Gifts that provide shared experiences have also proven successful, and the user is attracted to stories that invoke nostalgia and personal memories.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
Some negative experiences are evident from the user's interactions, primarily focusing on their disappointment in films that did not meet expectations. Specific titles were criticized for lacking quality and enjoyment, with the user expressing frustration over remakes and adaptations perceived as inferior. Furthermore, a lack of emotional connection with unsatisfactory storylines detracted from the viewing experience, indicating a desire for deeper engagement and resonance in the chosen media.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user's shopping behavior illustrates a balanced appreciation for diverse cinematic experiences, with a strong inclination towards family-friendly, engaging storytelling and educational documentaries. Positive interactions demonstrate a commitment to films that cultivate shared experiences and nostalgic connections. However, discontent arises from several films that failed to capture the user's interest or live up to prior versions, highlighting a critical expectation for quality in storytelling. This blend of enjoyment and disappointment creates a nuanced perspective on the user’s cinematic preferences.

target_interaction.title: Great grown-up fantasy!
target_interaction.text: I loved this movie. It provided everything that an adult fairytale should have. Anyone going to this movie thinking that it is a Disney style fantasy has not taken the time to notice the "R" rating.  There is indeed nudity, sex, murder, mayhem, as well as characters you love and characters you hate. I would highly recommend it to anyone who loves a good grown up fantasy.
